basics.name: Mathias Baumgartinger-Seiringer
basics.label: Computer Scientist. Academic.
basics.summary: My name is Mathias Baumgartinger-Seiringer. I am a creative developer that is passionate about craftsmanship surrounding software, games and other digital creations. Also, I am a firm believer in free and open source tools.

publications.name: Concepts of Virtual Reality in GIS
publications.summary: Due to the rapid progress of virtual reality hardware, these technologies are no longer niche products. Together with the much easier access to open geodata, new possibilities for procedural visualizations have opened up, combining Virtual Reality and GIS (VRGIS) technologies. In this bachelor thesis a prototypical implementation of a modern VRGIS software is presented, including concepts for movement, orientation and visualization of data.

publications.name: Large-Scale Agrivoltaics Visualisations for Assessing Landscape Impacts and Social Acceptance
publications.summary: Research article on large-scale agrivoltaics visualizations and their role in assessing landscape impacts and social acceptance.

publications.name: Fencing Virtual Landscapes: Using GIS to Identify and Classify Fences and Hedges for More Accurate Landscape Visualizations
publications.summary: Conference paper on using GIS to identify and classify fences and hedges for more accurate landscape visualizations.

publications.name: Real-Time VR Landscape Visualization for Wind Farm Repowering: A Case Study in Eastern Austrian World Heritage Sites
publications.summary: Conference paper presenting a case study on real-time VR landscape visualization for wind farm repowering in Eastern Austrian World Heritage Sites.

publications.name: Windenergie im Spannungsfeld: Gesellschaftliche Akzeptanz, ökologische Herausforderungen und innovative Lösungen
publications.summary: Poster presentation on wind energy in areas of tension: societal acceptance, ecological challenges, and innovative solutions.

publications.name: Photovoltaik, Mensch und Biosphäre: Ein transdisziplinärer Ansatz zur Förderung der alpinen Resilienz
publications.summary: Poster presentation on a transdisciplinary approach to promote alpine resilience through photovoltaics, human interaction, and biosphere considerations.

projects.name: WIMBY - Wind in My Backyard
projects.summary: Development of innovative tools to facilitate citizen and stakeholders interaction, knowledge sharing, and collaborative evaluation of impacts, conflicts, synergies and social innovation potential of wind energy.

projects.name: BioPV
projects.summary: Photovoltaics, people and the biosphere: a transdisciplinary approach to promote alpine resilience.

projects.name: LandscapeLab
projects.summary: An open kit for developing game-based participatory landscape-planning tools.
